intro: Anotis serpyllifolia, commonly known as common sandmat, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features a creeping stem system with numerous small, fleshy leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland dune environments. Anotis serpyllifolia is well adapted to arid conditions and has a widespread distribution across its native range.
